Breakthroughs you may have missed

A computer can now identify certain cancers as successfully as can skin-cancer doctors ( Nature paper ). But what are the implications for the future of medical diagnosis?

What mirrors tell us about animal minds

Are eagles intelligent enough to recognize their own reflections? We have no earthly idea. To paraphrase Frans de Waal, we’re not quite smart enough to know how smart animals are, and we need better tests of self-awareness and self-recognition.
